gamelogic.gamestate

Class AdaptiveDifficultyData

  • java.lang.Object
    • gamelogic.gamestate.AdaptiveDifficultyData

  • public class AdaptiveDifficultyData
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that keeps track of some data that is usefull for adaptive difficulty.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdaptiveDifficultyData(Problem teacherProblem, Problem currentProblem, int questionAmount, int preMistakeCount, int postMistakeCount, int[] featureUsage)
      Constructor of an AdaptiveDifficultyData object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean[] getFeatureMask()
      Returns a boolean mask of what features are in the current problem.
      int[] getFeatureUsage()
      Returns the amount of times certain features have been used for the current problem.
      int getPostMistakeCount()
      Returns the amount of mistakes made on the post condition.
      int getPreMistakeCount()
      Returns the amount of mistakes made on the pre condition.
      int getQuestionAmount()
      Returns the least amount of questions before the final problem.
      int getTeacherProblemDifficulty()
      Returns the difficulty of the teacher problem.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasArithmetic()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains arithmetic.

      Returns whether the teacher problem contains arrays.

      Returns whether the teacher problem contains equality.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasExists()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains the exists quantifier.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasForAll()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains the forall quantifier.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasImplication()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains implication.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasLogicOperator()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains logic operator.
      boolean getTeacherProblemHasRelationalComparer()
      Returns whether the teacher problem contains relational comparer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdaptiveDifficultyData

        public AdaptiveDifficultyData(Problem teacherProblem,
                              Problem currentProblem,
                              int questionAmount,
                              int preMistakeCount,
                              int postMistakeCount,
                              int[] featureUsage)
        Constructor of an AdaptiveDifficultyData object.
        Parameters:
        teacherProblem - The final teacher problem.
        currentProblem - The current problem.
        questionAmount - The least amount of problems before the final problem.
        preMistakeCount - Amount of mistakes currently made on the precondition of the current problem.
        postMistakeCount - Amount of mistakes currently made on the postcondition of the current problem.
        featureUsage - Amount of times different features have been used in the pre-and postconditions.
